column4: omg, just installed beryl.Restarted but i get the brown(?) screen after the login.PC disk busy, but nothing else.HELP

might wanna try to ctrl-alt-bkspc then if you made a copy of the xorg.conf file to something like xorg.conf.old then you can replace it, reboot and try again...to see if you get it restored.. to what it was..
i cant do anything it hangs booting into x after the login
before you log in...id try the ctrl-alt-bkspc to get to shell... then replace the xorg.conf.old file to xorg.conf...you DID make a copy to old of the original file right??
that was yes you made a copy? or yes youve already replaced it..and it still blows up
my bad - yes i did make a copy, ill try replacing it. Thanks
thats the first step...then get the damn thing restored...re-trace your steps trhough the how to for beryl and see if it is missing something..
when i did an upgrade on my dapper...it broke a lot of shi** ...but when i did a fresh install of edgy...wham fixed.
once you get it working...youll like beryl..its pretty pimp
uncanny. I had a working xgl on dapper, but the upgrade was messy, so fresh installed edgy, automatix2 put on the nvid driver .8xxxx .
what ver nvid driver you using?
stangely its an intel card....on my Sony...but it finally worked
with my laptop its an ATI and ive really never got beryl working right on the poor bastard.
hey thanks im gonna have another go - im currently talking from the darkside (XP) , force..is...gett..ing...weak.... :)
